newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil holds firm at close.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil holds firm at close.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Prices held firm at close with underlying firm fundamentals aiding sentiment. There were a lot of switching activity of March/April and March/May. Traders expect the market to firm on expectation of fresh demand. April futures will trade in 1,255-1,280 range.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL - The market held steady. Interest seen among nearby crude palm oil and selected products.
Crop forecaster Ivan Wong on Tuesday estimated Malaysia's palm oil stocks at the end of January at 730,000 tonnes against market expectation of 750,000 tonnes.

One trader said the market was not following the trend in Chicago soyoil futures. "If soyoil prices hit limit-up or limit-down, then we may see some reactions in the market. If not the market is more concerned over fundamentals and currency factors," he said.
Trading was volatile and turnover was 2,474 lots.
Third month April futures closed eight ringgit higher at 1,273 ringgit ($511.35) a tonne after trading in a 16-ringgit range.
Physical Jan (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,340 against bids at 1,335, after trading at 1,335 and 1.340.
Jan (central) was offered at 1,335 and bids at 1,330, and Jan (north) at 1,317.50 against 1,310.
Feb (south) saw offers at 1,340 with bids at 1,337.50 with earlier trades at 1,335 and 1,340. Feb (central) was offered at 1,330 against bids at 1,325.
Among refined products, Feb RBD palm oil was offered at $565 a tonne FOB Malaysia and Mar at $557.50. Mar was dealt at $555.
Feb RBD palm olein saw offers at $597.50, Mar at $590 and Apr/May/Jun at $577.50. Mar was traded at $587.50 and Apr/May/Jun at $575 and $577.50.
Feb/Mar RBD palm stearin was offered at $442.50 and Feb/Mar palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $302.50.
